stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
Bem-vindo ao primeiro encontro da Logos Circle Lisbon!
Desde a crise da habitação e insegurança alimentar até à autonomia digital e ao capitalismo de vigilância, acreditamos que a mudança real começa ao nível local. Este primeiro evento é uma oportunidade para conhecer e conectar com os teus pares, alinhar propósitos e começar a lançar as bases para projectos com impacto. Todos são bem-vindos, quer já queiras envolver-te activamente ou estejas apenas curioso para saber mais.
Agenda
Bebidas e petiscos de boas-vindas
Aproveita snacks e bebidas de origem local enquanto nos cumprimentamos e nos instalamos.
Apresentações
Conhece os Admins da Logos Circle Lisbon. Serás convidado a partilhar um pouco da tua história e o que torna este trabalho significativo para ti.
Foco em questões locais
Uma conversa sobre iniciativas locais já em curso, desafios emergentes e como a Logos pode apoiar através da acção social.
Despedida
Partilharemos o plano de acção para te envolveres e quando nos voltamos a encontrar.
Sobre a Logos
A Logos é uma stack tecnológica totalmente descentralizada, que preserva a privacidade e é politicamente neutra. A stack inclui três protocolos modulares e descentralizados: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage) e Waku (mensagens). Juntos, oferecem a base técnica para cibersistemas, sociedades paralelas, network states ou qualquer instituição pública sem fronteiras baseada no consentimento voluntário.
A Logos é também um conjunto de comunidades de aprendizagem que governarão e sustentarão a rede no espírito dos cypherpunks originais. Juntas, formam o movimento de base necessário para construir as instituições sociais, económicas e de governação que viverão sobre esta stack tecnológica.
Com o tempo, estas instituições irão formar um mercado competitivo capaz de colmatar falhas na governação do mundo real, oferecendo serviços públicos resistentes à corrupção e baseados na confiança mínima, onde quer que a internet chegue.
Lê o nosso manifesto para mergulhar mais a fundo nos nossos ideais e tecnologia.

Welcome to the first gathering of the Logos Circle Lisbon!
From housing and food insecurity to digital autonomy and surveillance capitalism, we believe real change starts at the local level. This first event is a chance to meet and connect with your peers, align on purpose, and begin laying the groundwork for projects that matter. Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to get involved or just curious to learn more.
Agenda
Welcome drinks and snacks
Enjoy locally sourced snacks and drinks while we say hello and settle in.
Introductions
Get to know your local Logos Circle Admins. You’ll be invited to share a bit about your story and why this work is meaningful to you.
Focus on local issues
A discussion about local initiatives already underway, emerging challenges, and how Logos can support through social action.
Farewell!
We’ll share the roadmap for how you can get involved and when we’ll gather again.
About Logos
Logos is a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging). Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyber states, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
Logos is also a collection of learning communities that will govern and sustain the network in the spirit of the original cypherpunks. Together, they form the grassroots movement needed to build the social, economic, and governing institutions that will live on the technology stack.
Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.

O Logos Circle Lisboa está animado por participar na nossa primeira ação de voluntariado para retribuir à comunidade! Junta-te a nós para apoiar criativos locais, e se tens ideias sobre como a tecnologia descentralizada pode ajudar a valorizar o seu trabalho, queremos muito ouvi-las.
Sobre o Encontro
Quem disse que pausa criativa significa parar? A partir deste domingo, 8 de Junho, começamos os nossos encontros semanais de detox digital - momentos para mexer na terra, construir com as mãos e repensar o espaço do Arroz juntes.

A primeira sessão (14h) será para conversarmos sobre o plano, fazer alguma limpeza e começar a dar forma a este projeto comunitário.
Nas próximas semanas: recolher materiais, construir estruturas e criar o jardim que queremos ver crescer.

Juntámos tudo num grupo de WhatsApp para combinarmos tarefas, trocar ideias e mantermos uma comunicação próxima.

Tragam roupa velha e vontade de meter as mãos na massa.
https://chat.whatsapp.com/GrAmaKwj4Cf1RJ9nVsJpp1?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAadPF4pbLYu5nUPc9PHx6bGBQdnvkPum_4ofJhLJ8hrRxfGpsudvQZbnmjDlzA_aem_DF2uWzIYEvAQAFn8SyfBcQ

The Logos Lisbon Circle is excited to participate in our first volunteer action to give back to the community!
Join us as we show support for local creatives, and if you’ve got ideas for how decentralised tech can help elevate their work, we’d love to hear from you.
About the Meetup
Creative pause doesn’t mean stopping. Starting this Sunday, June 8th, we’re hosting weekly digital detox meet-ups - moments to dig in the soil, build with our hands, and reimagine Arroz’s space together.

The first session at 14h will be for discussing plans, some cleaning, and shaping this community project.
In the coming weeks: collecting materials, building structures, and growing the garden we want to see flourish.

We’ve set up a WhatsApp group (link in bio) to coordinate tasks, share ideas and keep communication direct

Bring old clothes and a readiness to get your hands dirty.
https://chat.whatsapp.com/GrAmaKwj4Cf1RJ9nVsJpp1?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAadPF4pbLYu5nUPc9PHx6bGBQdnvkPum_4ofJhLJ8hrRxfGpsudvQZbnmjDlzA_aem_DF2uWzIYEvAQAFn8SyfBcQ

stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
About the Event
Builders, technologists, cypherpunks, and free thinkers: we invite you to the first edition of Logos Circles Meetup Brno!

This DevConf.cz side event opens up a new Logos Circles group in Brno. It is an opportunity for our community and anyone interested to join Logos core contributor Václav Pavlín to discuss technical and philosophical topics at the intersection of human governance and blockchain technology in relaxed surroundings.
Together, we can realise the latent cypherpunk dream of a cyberstate or network state via a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack.
Sign up to join us on 12th June 2025 for drinks and stimulating discussions.
Programme:
18:00 - 19:00: Drinks and discussion
19:00 - 20:00: From Parallel Polis to Decentralised Governance – fun exercise, quick presentation and a discussion on the future of human organisation
21:00: Soft close
From Parallel Polis to Decentralised Governance
Václav Benda wrote “Parallel Polis” in 1978 during the dark days of communist oppression. He tried to summarise how a parallel polis – or second culture – can thrive in the context of an authoritarian state. The world has changed since 1978, but the need for parallel societies lives on and will continue as long as governments fail to adequately support their citizens.
Let’s discuss what we can learn from Parallel Polis and how to apply the strongest ideas to our current context. How can we build a better future and administer governance that serves us as individuals and our communities? Is decentralisation the path forward? Are blockchain technologies the solution? How are these technologies and governance models even related to Parallel Polis?
First, we’ll do a fun exercise - guided imagery, then provide historical background with a short presentation before discussing the opportunities presented by recent technological breakthroughs in the context of human governance.
Limited capacity | Registration required
About Logos
Logos is an open-source community building a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging). Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyberstates, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
As a community, Logos not only develops and maintains these technologies but also uses them as a base to deploy parallel governance institutions to those mandated by nation states. Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach. If these ideas speak to you, we hope you will contribute your passion and skills to Logos.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.
Get involved by joining our Discord.

Welcome to the first Logos Circle in Zanzibar!
We're excited to host this first Logos Circle in Zanzibar, taking place alongside Zanzalu.
This gathering is part of a growing network of Logos Circles around the world that explore how decentralised tools, local knowledge, and collective action can help solve real-world issues from the ground up.
For this session, we’ll focus on Tanzania’s employment crisis, one of the most pressing challenges facing the country. Our goal is to begin mapping the issue together, get to know each other’s skills and experiences, and lay the groundwork for local solutions that can grow beyond this event.
Everyone’s welcome, whether you’re deeply involved in this issue already or just curious to learn and contribute.

Agenda
Arrival + Opening Circle
Welcome drinks and introductions.
What is Logos & What Are Circles?
A short intro to Logos: the technology stack, the network state vision, and how Circles act as entry points for local action.
Understanding the Employment Crisis
A collective mapping of the problem: what do we know about youth unemployment, informal work, and access to economic opportunity in Tanzania? What’s already being done and what’s missing?
Skills Exchange + Group Discussion
Let’s get to know each other better. What strengths, networks, or lived experience do we each bring to the table? Where could collaboration happen?
Wrap Up + What’s Next
We’ll outline the next steps and invite everyone to the evening session.

Evening Workshop @ Johnnie’s Café (18:00)
This more hands-on session will explore practical responses to the challenges discussed earlier in the day. We’ll break into smaller groups to generate project ideas, sketch out roles, and build momentum toward pilot solutions.

About Logos
Logos is a sovereign, decentralised technology stack that realises the cypherpunk vision of autonomous digital territories and network states. It is designed to champion personal liberties and collective abundance through upgrading human governance.
About Zanzalu
Zanzalu is a pop-up city located in Fumba Town, Zanzibar that brings together builders, artists, entrepreneurs, and researchers from across Africa and beyond. Our mission is to help build the innovation ecosystem in East Africa. Over several weeks, participants live, work, and co-create in community, exploring themes related to frontier tech, innovative governance, and the cities of tomorrow.

Join this Logos Circle for a practical workshop focused on equipping you to lead change in your local community.
Whether you've already hosted a meetup or you're just curious about stepping up, this workshop is all about sharing what we've learned so far (what works, what doesn’t) and giving you the tools to launch and grow a Logos Circle in your city. You'll leave with practical resources, inspiration from others, and a clear sense of next steps.
This session is part of the wider Zanzalu initiative—an evolving network of temporary, experimental communities rooted in local action and global collaboration.

Agenda
Welcome
Settle in, meet the group, and hear a short intro on how this session fits into the broader Logos & Zanzalu movement.
Why Circles?
A brief overview of the purpose and structure of Logos Circles, and how they tie into local organising and global change.
Tools, templates & tactics
We'll walk through everything from how to structure your first meetup, to surfacing winnable issues, and sustaining momentum.
Stories from the field
Hear real examples of Circles already underway—what’s worked, what hasn’t, and what they’ve learned.
Open discussion & support
Bring your own context (city, group, idea) and we’ll workshop next steps together.
Closing & roadmap
Leave with a clear plan, resources to take home, and ways to stay supported by the wider network.

About Logos
Logos is a sovereign, decentralised technology stack that realises the cypherpunk vision of autonomous digital territories and network states. It is designed to champion personal liberties and collective abundance through upgrading human governance.
About Zanzalu
Zanzalu is a pop-up city located in Fumba Town, Zanzibar that brings together builders, artists, entrepreneurs, and researchers from across Africa and beyond. Our mission is to help build the innovation ecosystem in East Africa. Over several weeks, participants live, work, and co-create in community, exploring themes related to frontier tech, innovative governance, and the cities of tomorrow.

This workshop picks up where our last session session left off. After mapping out the roots of Tanzania’s employment crisis and understanding the skills in the room, we’ll shift into a plan of action for how we can begin tackling this issue.
This session is part of Zanzalu, a temporary gathering space for builders, organisers, and dreamers shaping new ways of living and working. Logos Circles are local, community-led spaces for exploring how decentralised tech can support real-world challenges.

Agenda
Arrival & Welcome
Grab a drink, settle in, and meet others. Informal check-in for those who missed the previous session.
Recap from Day Session
Quick overview of what was discussed last session:
Roots of Tanzania’s employment crisis
Key themes and challenges surfaced
Skills and interests in the room
Framing the Challenge
Group discussion: What real interventions feel possible?
How can we support youth employment, entrepreneurship, or community-led solutions?
Breakout: Project Jam
Small group working sessions:
Pick a focus area (e.g. skills mapping, microgrants, creative economy)
Sketch out one practical initiative
Identify what’s needed (people, partners, tech, funding, etc.)
Shareback & Feedback
Each group shares their idea in a couple of minutes.
Open floor for feedback, additions, and offers of support.
Next Steps
How to stay involved and continue working on ideas throughout the duration of Zanzalu and beyond.
Close & Hangout
Stick around to chat and connect.

About Logos
Logos is a sovereign, decentralised technology stack that realises the cypherpunk vision of autonomous digital territories and network states. It is designed to champion personal liberties and collective abundance through upgrading human governance.

Our mission is to help build the innovation ecosystem in East Africa. Over several weeks, participants live, work, and co-create in community, exploring themes related to frontier tech, innovative governance, and the cities of tomorrow.

This final Logos Circle of Zanzalu offers a moment to pause, reflect, and prepare for what comes next. Through the Circles, we’ve explored bold ideas, tackled complex problems like Tanzania’s employment crisis, and grown as leaders and collaborators. Now it’s time to take stock and start translating it all into action beyond Zanzalu.
Whether you’re continuing work on a specific project, starting a Circle in your city, or still figuring out your next move, this is a space to share, learn from each other, and align on how we carry this momentum forward.

Agenda
Welcome & Arrival
A gentle open-in reconnecting as a group.
What We’ve Learned
A guided group reflection to surface key takeaways, breakthroughs, and lessons from the past week.
Project Spotlights
Participants share updates on active workstreams (e.g. Tanzanian employment), what’s working, and where support is needed.
Carrying It Forward
Collaboratively mapping next steps: launching Circles, continuing projects, and staying connected after Zanzalu.
Close & Commitments
We’ll finish with a round of personal commitments and acknowledgements, small or big, individual or collective.

¡Bienvenidos al segundo Logos Circle en San José, Costa Rica!
Costa Rica se posiciona como líder en innovación tecnológica y sostenibilidad en América Latina. Es el momento perfecto para explorar las sociedades paralelas, digitales y soberanas e impulsar un impacto colectivo real desde nuestra región.
Logos en colaboración con DecentralU y Dojo Coding se unen para reunir a cypherpunks, builders, tecnólogos, artistas, periodistas, activistas y líderes comunitarios para crear un espacio regular de diálogo, colaboración y acción sobre los temas que más nos importan.
¿Te interesa la privacidad digital, la descentralización y construir el futuro de la web? Este es tu lugar.

Agenda
Bebidas & snacks – Bienvenida y encuentro.
Presentaciones – Organizadores y participantes.
Logos & Sociedades Paralelas – Introducción + Q&A.
Temas locales – Retos e iniciativas a desarrollar.
Próximos pasos – Hoja de ruta y cierre.

¿Qué es Logos?
Logos un movimiento y tecnología para empoderar a una generación de pioneros digitales que transformen la privacidad y la autonomía de ideales a realidades.
Desarrollamos protocolos descentralizados para:
Governance (Nomos) - Consenso privado y soberano
Storage (Codex) - Almacenamiento resistente a la censura
Messaging (Waku) - Comunicaciones privadas y escalables
Estos forman la base tecnológica para sociedades paralelas y instituciones sin fronteras basadas en el consentimiento voluntario.
Como movimiento de base, Logos construye comunidades locales que sostienen la red en el espíritu de los cypherpunks originales.
Lee nuestro manifiesto para saber más →

Conoce a nuestros partners:
¿Qué es DecentralU?
DecentralU es una comunidad creada para impulsar carreras profesionales en Web3, con mentores que han estado allí y conexiones que abren puertas. Somos el HUB de oportunidades Web3: abrimos la puerta a quienes buscan algo mejor y quieren construir su futuro en este nuevo ecosistema.
¿Qué es Dojo Coding?
Dojo Coding es la comunidad de developers más grande de LATAM. Conectamos talento con tecnologías emergentes como Web3 y AI, y actuamos como incubadora de proyectos para impulsar la próxima generación de builders innovadores.

¿Quién debería asistir?
Desarrolladores interesados en tecnologías emergentes
Tecnólogos que valoran la privacidad y descentralización
Emprendedores explorando nuevos modelos de negocio
Activistas trabajando en derechos digitales
Estudiantes curiosos sobre el futuro de internet
Cualquier persona interesada en construir un futuro más libre y descentralizado
No se requiere experiencia previa.
Únete al Telegram oficial de Logos, si tienes preguntas hazlas en el canal San Jose-Circle

The LA area's vibrant tech and creative community is perfectly positioned to explore network state concepts and drive collaborative social impact. Join us as we create a regular space for meaningful dialogue, relationship building, and collective action on the issues that matter most to our community.

The inaugural Logos Circle: Los Angeles event is an opportunity to connect, align on shared purpose, and start leveraging the Logos tech stack for projects that can make a real difference in LA. Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to dive in or simply curious to explore.

Introductions & community building

Introduction to Logos & Network States

Exploring LA's challenges & opportunities
A collaborative discussion on local issues facing our community, emerging challenges, and existing initiatives. Together we'll identify where Logos tools and networks can support real world action in Los Angeles.
Logos ecosystem showcase
Discover what's already been accomplished with existing Logos circles around the world and how we can build on their success here in LA.
Planning our path forward
We'll wrap up with concrete next steps: how to stay engaged, ways to contribute, and when we'll gather again to continue building our community.
Logos swag & resources
Take home Logos zines, stickers, and other goodies, plus get onboarded to our forums and discord communities.

Welcome to the first Logos Circle Prague, a special edition hosted at Dark Prague!
From housing and food insecurity to digital autonomy and surveillance capitalism, we believe real change starts at the local level. This first event is a chance to meet and connect with your peers, align on purpose, and begin laying the groundwork for projects that matter. Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to get involved or just curious to learn more.
Agenda
Introductions
Get to know your local Logos contributors. You’ll be invited to share a bit about your story and why this work is meaningful to you.
Discussion on Logos
Learn more about Logos, Logos Circles, and how you can help pioneer the Prague Circle.
Focus on local issues
A discussion about local initiatives already underway, emerging challenges, and how Logos can support through collective action.
Farewell!
We’ll share the roadmap for how you can get involved and when we’ll gather again.
About Logos
Logos is a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging). Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyber states, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
Logos is also a collection of learning communities that will govern and sustain the network in the spirit of the original cypherpunks. Together, they form the grassroots movement needed to build the social, economic, and governing institutions that will live on the technology stack.
Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.
About Dark Prague
Technology is the battlefield. Biology is the frontier. Networks are the lifeblood. This is where we examine systems to dismantle them, fork them, or remake them.
In the flicker between freedom and control, shadows move. They are thinkers, builders, breakers, not invited, not waiting.
This is not a conference. This is a signal — low-res, high-risk, peer-to-peer.
The first of many to start the next chapter, a successor to the Hackers Congress Paralelní Polis core, now fed by the roots of life, the edge of science, and the code of exile.

¡Bienvenidos al primer Logos Circle en San José, Costa Rica!
Costa Rica se posiciona como líder en innovación tecnológica y sostenibilidad en América Latina. Es el momento perfecto para explorar los network states (estados de red) e impulsar un impacto colectivo real desde nuestra región.
Logos en colaboración con DecentralU y Dojo Coding se unen para reunir a cypherpunks, builders, tecnólogos, artistas, periodistas, activistas y líderes comunitarios para crear un espacio regular de diálogo, colaboración y acción sobre los temas que más nos importan.
¿Te interesa la privacidad digital, la descentralización y construir el futuro de la web? Este es tu lugar.

Agenda
Bebidas & snacks – Bienvenida y encuentro.
Presentaciones – Organizadores y participantes.
Logos & Network States – Introducción + Q&A.
Temas locales – Retos e iniciativas.
Próximos pasos – Hoja de ruta y cierre.

¿Qué es Logos?
Logos es una tecnología y movimiento completamente descentralizado, resistente a la censura, que preserva la privacidad y políticamente neutral.
Desarrollamos protocolos descentralizados para:
Governance (Nomos) - Consenso privado y soberano
Storage (Codex) - Almacenamiento resistente a la censura
Messaging (Waku) - Comunicaciones privadas y escalables
Estos forman la base tecnológica para network states, sociedades paralelas y instituciones sin fronteras basadas en el consentimiento voluntario.
Como movimiento de base, Logos construye comunidades locales que sostienen la red en el espíritu de los cypherpunks originales.
Lee nuestro manifiesto para saber más →

Conoce a nuestros partners:
¿Qué es DecentralU?
DecentralU es una comunidad creada para impulsar carreras profesionales en Web3, con mentores que han estado allí y conexiones que abren puertas. Somos el HUB de oportunidades Web3: abrimos la puerta a quienes buscan algo mejor y quieren construir su futuro en este nuevo ecosistema.
¿Qué es Dojo Coding?
Dojo Coding es la comunidad de developers más grande de LATAM. Conectamos talento con tecnologías emergentes como Web3 y AI, y actuamos como incubadora de proyectos para impulsar la próxima generación de builders innovadores.

¿Quién debería asistir?
Desarrolladores interesados en tecnologías emergentes
Tecnólogos que valoran la privacidad y descentralización
Emprendedores explorando nuevos modelos de negocio
Activistas trabajando en derechos digitales
Estudiantes curiosos sobre el futuro de internet
Cualquier persona interesada en construir un futuro más libre y descentralizado
No se requiere experiencia previa.
Únete al Telegram oficial de Logos, si tienes preguntas hazlas en el canal San Jose-Circle

stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
Welcome to the first Logos Circle gathering in Rome, taking place during Urbe Village!
In Part 1, we’ll open a discussion on key community issues — from housing and food insecurity to digital autonomy and surveillance capitalism.
We believe real change begins at the local level. Logos Circles are a global network of autonomous groups uniting people to strengthen their communities and create meaningful social impact.
In Part 2, you’ll take part in a hands-on workshop exploring Waku, the Logos peer-to-peer communications layer, followed by a presentation on Nomos, the peer-to-peer consensus layer.
Following this amazing morning, we'll have a nice lunch all together next door.

Part 1: 9:30 - 11:30am
Agenda
Welcome
Take some time to meet the Logos core contributors, Circle organisers, and fellow participants.
Introductions
Sitting in a circle, each person shares a little about their story and why this work matters to them.
Introductions to Logos
Learn about the Logos technology stack, the role of Circles, and why we organise in this way.
Technology and Winnable Issues
Hear stories from other Circles about how they have applied Logos technology to local challenges, and explore potential use cases for tackling winnable issues.
Starting a Circle in Your City
If you feel inspired to launch a Circle where you live, we will share practical tips and next steps to help you get started.

Part 2: 11:30am - 1:30pm
Waku Workshop with Václav Pavlín :
1. The Logos stack: Waku, Codex and Nomos
2. Why do we build these tools
3. Hands on Waku integration into a webapp
Presentation by Shirly Valge on “The Importance of Private Proof of Stake in Facilitating Network States and Human Liberty.”
LUNCH next door 1:30pm

About Logos

stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
Welcome to the first gathering of the Logos Circle doha!
From housing and food insecurity to digital autonomy and surveillance capitalism, we believe real change starts at the local level. This first event is a chance to meet and connect with your peers, align on purpose, and begin laying the groundwork for projects that matter. Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to get involved or just curious to learn more.
Agenda:
12:00 – 12:10 PM — Welcome Drinks & Opening Remarks
We’ll start the day with locally sourced snacks and refreshments as we settle in.
Khadijah Amusat will officially open the session, introduce the Logos Circle Doha, and share the purpose and goals of today’s gathering.
12:10 – 12:25 PM — Introductions
Meet your local Logos Circle Admins and fellow participants. Everyone will be invited to briefly share their story, what drew them to Web3, and why this work resonates with them.
12:25 – 12:45 PM — Understanding Logos Circles: Why We Organize This Way
This session explores the idea behind Logos Circles — decentralized local communities working toward shared goals. We’ll discuss how these circles contribute to the larger vision of building open, self-sovereign, and censorship-resistant systems.
12:45 – 1:30 PM — Roundtable Discussion: Decentralized Privacy & Logos as a Cyber State
An open, interactive discussion moderated by Khadijah Amusat exploring digital privacy, data ownership, and the social implications of decentralized infrastructure.
We’ll also dive into Logos’ vision as a cyber-state and the role of Waku in enabling peer-to-peer communication, censorship resistance, and community coordination.
1:30 – 2:25 PM — Community Onboarding & Local Initiatives
A participatory session focused on hearing from everyone in the Circle.
We’ll discuss:
Local issues participants care about
How Logos’ tools and technologies can be applied to address real-world challenges in Doha and the region
Collaborative ideas for future projects and community-driven action
This will be a key part of the session — giving everyone space to contribute, brainstorm, and co-create.
2:25 – 2:45 PM — Next Steps & Upcoming Opportunities
Learn how to get involved with the broader Logos community, join upcoming projects, and explore open bounties such as the RealFi Hackathon and Logos 8K challenge.
2:45 – 3:00 PM — Farewell & Networking
We’ll wrap up with closing remarks, quick announcements, and casual networking over light refreshments.
About logos
Logos is a fully decentralized, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack.
It includes three modular protocols — Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging) — forming the foundation for cyber states, network states, and digital-first public institutions based on voluntary participation.
Beyond the tech, Logos is a movement  a federation of learning communities and builders dedicated to creating trust-minimized, transparent systems that can provide governance and public services wherever the internet can reach.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology

Logos Circles are self-organizing local groups that strengthen civil society by tackling the needs of their communities. They are a practical way to put decentralized, values-driven action into motion.
During the meeting, we will provide an overview of the Logos organization and movement, followed by a deeper dive into the Logos Circle network, including how it works, what leadership entails, and ways to get involved.

Logos Circles
Logos
It’s important to note that Logos is not only building a sovereign technology stack for cyberstates, but is also a principle-first, cypherpunk community. We are as committed to building strong, resilient communities through grassroots activism and hands-on effort as we are to developing secure protocols backed by robust encryption.

La comunitat tecnològica i creativa de Barcelona és l’espai perfecte per explorar els network states (estats en xarxa) i generar impacte col·lectiu. Amb el suport d’AKASHA Hub, reunim cypherpunks, tecnòlegs, artistes, periodistes, activistes, entitats locals i líders comunitaris.
Creem un espai regular per al diàleg, la col·laboració i l’acció sobre els temes clau de la comunitat.

Begudes & pizza – Benvinguda i encontre.

I aquest cop… farem un giveaway d’1 entrada per al Mozilla Festival 2025 🎟️ entre els assistents!

Logos és una tecnologia i moviment descentralitzat, neutral i respectuós amb la privacitat. Impulsa protocols peer-to-peer de governança, arxiu i missatgeria — base dels network states (estats en xarxa) i institucions sense fronteres.
Com a moviment de base, Logos construeix comunitats locals que sostenen la xarxa en l’esperit dels cypherpunks.
Llegeix el nostre manifest per saber-ne més.

La comunidad tecnológica y creativa de Barcelona es el lugar ideal para explorar los network states (estados en red) e impulsar un impacto colectivo. Con el apoyo de AKASHA Hub, reunimos a cypherpunks, tecnólogos, artistas, periodistas, activistas, organizaciones locales y líderes comunitarios.
Creamos un espacio regularmente para el diálogo, la colaboración y la acción en torno a los temas que más nos importan.

Como movimiento de base, Logos crea comunidades locales que sostienen la red en el espíritu de los cypherpunks.
Lee nuestro manifiesto para saber más.

Welcome to the Logos Circle Barcelona #3!
Barcelona’s creative and tech community, rooted in its culture and history, is the perfect place to explore network states and drive collective impact. With support from AKASHA Hub, we gather cypherpunks, technologists, artists, journalists, activists, local charities and community leaders.
Join us to open a regular space for dialogue, collaboration, and action on the issues that matter most.
Languages: English, Spanish, Catalan
Agenda
Drinks & pizza – Meet and settle in.
Introductions – Organisers + participants share stories.
Logos & Network States – Why we’re building them + Q&A.
Local issues – Group discussion on challenges & initiatives.
Next steps – Roadmap and farewell.
We’ll also be giving away 1 ticket to Mozilla Festival 2025 🎟️ during the event!
About Logos
Logos is a decentralised, privacy-preserving, neutral technology and movement. It powers peer-to-peer protocols for governance, storage, and messaging — foundations for network states and borderless institutions.
As a grassroots movement, Logos builds local communities to sustain the network in the spirit of the cypherpunks.
Read our manifesto to learn more.

¡Bienvenidos al primer encuentro del Círculo Logos Ciudad de México!
Desde la vivienda y la inseguridad alimentaria hasta la autonomía digital y el capitalismo vigilante, creemos que el cambio real comienza a nivel local.
Este primer evento es una oportunidad para conocer y conectar con tus pares, alinearse en el propósito, y comenzar a sentar las bases para proyectos que impacten.
Todos son bienvenidos, ya sea que estés listo para involucrarte o simplemente tengas curiosidad por aprender más.
Agenda
Bebidas y aperitivos de bienvenida
Disfruta de aperitivos y bebidas mientras nos saludamos y nos acomodamos.
Presentaciones
Conoce a los Administradores de tu Círculo Logos CdMx.
Te invitaremos a compartir un poco sobre tu historia y por qué esto es significativo para ti.
Enfoque en temas locales
Una discusión sobre iniciativas locales ya en marcha, desafíos emergentes, y cómo Logos puede apoyar a través de la acción social.
¡Hasta la próxima!
Compartiremos la hoja de ruta sobre cómo puedes involucrarte y cuándo nos reuniremos nuevamente.
Acerca de Logos
Logos es un stack tecnológico completamente descentralizado que preserva la privacidad y es políticamente neutral. El stack tecnológico incluye tres protocolos modulares y descentralizados: Nomos (consenso), Codex (almacenamiento), y Waku (mensajería). Combinados, proporcionan la base técnica para los ciber-estados, las sociedades paralelas, los estados-red, o cualquier institución pública sin fronteras basada en el consentimiento voluntario.
Logos es también una colección de comunidades de aprendizaje que gobernarán y sostendrán la red, en el espíritu de los cypherpunks originales. Juntos, forman el movimiento de base necesario para construir las instituciones sociales, económicas y de gobernanza que vivirán en el stack tecnológico.
Eventualmente, estas instituciones poblarán un mercado competitivo que puede llenar los vacíos en la gobernanza del mundo actual, proporcionando servicios públicos con mínima dependencia de confianza y resistentes a la corrupción dondequiera que el internet pueda llegar.
Lee nuestro Manifesto para profundizar en nuestros ideales y tecnología.

stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
Welcome to the second Logos Circle in Benin, Nigeria!
This gathering is part of a growing network of Logos Circles around the world that explore how decentralised tools, local knowledge, and collective action can help solve real-world issues from the ground up.
For this second Benin Circle, we’ll use the Helena Food in The University of Benin space to connect, share experiences, and begin mapping out how Logos Circles in Nigeria can address pressing local challenges through community-driven solutions.
Everyone is welcome—whether you’re already engaged in grassroots initiatives, experimenting with decentralised tools, or simply curious to learn and contribute.
Agenda
What is Logos & What Are Circles?
An introduction to Logos: the technology stack, the network state vision, and how Circles serve as entry points for local action.
Benin in Focus
An open discussion on the opportunities and challenges facing communities in Benin City today. How can local knowledge, skills, and networks combine with decentralised tools to make a difference?
Skills Exchange + Group Dialogue
A chance to get to know each other better—what experience, talents, or perspectives do we each bring? Where could collaboration emerge?
Wrap Up + What’s Next
Outlining possible next steps for the Benin Circle and inviting participants to stay connected as the local network grows.
About Logos
Logos is a sovereign, decentralised technology stack that realises the cypherpunk vision of autonomous digital territories and network states. It is designed to champion personal liberties and collective abundance through upgrading human governance.

Welcome to the Logos Circle London chapter!
We believe real change starts at the local level. This is a chance to meet and connect with your peers, align on purpose, and begin laying the groundwork for projects that matter.
Join us in the heart of the City at The Vintry EC4, steps from the Monument to the Great Fire of London. Fun fact: This 202-foot Doric column, crowned by a gilded flame, exactly 202 feet west of where the 1666 fire started, stands as tribute to London's unbreakable spirit, honouring the city's phoenix-like rebirth and rapid reconstruction into a grander metropolis.
Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to get involved or just curious to learn more.
Agenda
Welcome drinks and snacks
Find us downstairs in the pub, get social and settle in with snacks and drinks.
Introductions
Meet your local Logos Circle leader and fellow participants. You’ll be invited to share a bit of your story — why you’re here and what draws you to this work.
Intro to Logos & Cyber States
A short talk from the Circle Leader: what is Logos, why are we building cyber states, and how this can drive real local change, followed by an open Q&A.
Surfacing local issues
A group discussion on local issues, emerging challenges, and active initiatives. Together we’ll explore where Logos tools and networks can support real-world action.
Next steps & farewell
We’ll close with a clear roadmap: how you can stay involved, take action, and when we’ll gather again.

About Logos
Logos is the sovereign digital infrastructure that enables parallel trans-national societies at scale. We build privacy-preserving networks that are resilient against hostile adversaries, uphold civil liberties through competitive legitimate governance, and serve as the foundation for new social and economic structures in cyberspace.
As a grassroots movement, Logos builds local communities to sustain the network in the spirit of the cypherpunks.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.

Welcome to a special edition of the Logos Circle Buenos Aires happening at Funding the Commons Buenos Aires!
We’ll open a discussion on key community issues — from housing and food insecurity to digital autonomy and surveillance capitalism.
We believe real change begins at the local level. Logos Circles are a global network of autonomous groups uniting people to strengthen their communities and create meaningful social impact.

Agenda
Welcome
Take some time to meet the Logos core contributors, Circle organisers, and fellow participants.
Introductions
Sitting in a circle, each person shares a little about their story and why this work matters to them.
Introductions to Logos
Learn about the Logos technology stack, the role of Circles, and why we organise in this way.
Technology and Winnable Issues
Hear stories from other Circles about how they have applied Logos technology to local challenges, and explore potential use cases for tackling winnable issues.
Starting a Circle in Your City
If you feel inspired to launch a Circle where you live, we will share practical tips and next steps to help you get started.

About Logos
Logos is a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging). Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyber states, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
Logos is also a collection of learning communities that will govern and sustain the network in the spirit of the original cypherpunks. Together, they form the grassroots movement needed to build the social, economic, and governing institutions that will live on the technology stack.
Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.

About Funding the Commons Buenos Aires
At Funding the Commons: Buenos Aires, we’ll explore problems that matter to everyday life—how to send money across borders, coordinate shared treasuries, participate in governance, verify identity with privacy, build open AI for the public good, and protect shared environmental resources. Hosting the event during DevConnect is a chance to connect these challenges with global builders.

Circles Latam – Primer Círculo en Buenos Aires

¡Bienvenidos al primer Circulo de Logos en Buenos Aires!
En el marco de Devconnect, inauguramos oficialmente la llegada de Circles a Latinoamérica. Buenos Aires se convierte así en la ciudad #22 del movimiento, impulsada por una comunidad diversa, curiosa y comprometida, lista para explorar y ejercer el 5to poder bajo la ciudadanía digital.
El mundo enfrenta problemas de acceso a la vivienda, calidad educativa, alimentación, acceso al financiamiento, identidad y autonomía digital.
Dentro del Círculo creemos que el cambio real empieza a nivel local: este primer encuentro es una oportunidad para conocernos, alinearnos y empezar a construir la base de proyectos que realmente importan.
Todos son bienvenidos: quienes quieran involucrarse activamente, quienes vienen a explorar o quienes simplemente sienten curiosidad por como funciona Circles.

Agenda
Bienvenida
Mientras nos acomodamos y presentamos vamos a compartir unos tragos y algo rico para comer.
Introducción
Los organizadores nos vamos a presentar y los vamos a invitar a que compartan brevemente su historia, su interés en Circles y cómo les gustaría ver crecer en la región.
Circles en el contexto local
Conversamos sobre iniciativas locales, desafíos emergentes, mecanismos de reputación y coordinación, y cómo Circles puede apoyar distintos proyectos sociales, instituciones y organizaciones.
Cómo involucrarse y próximos pasos
Cerramos compartiendo el roadmap, oportunidades para participar, y cuándo volveremos a reunirnos.

Sobre Circles y Logos
Circles es un experimento que comenzó en el año 2024 y se viene llevando a cabo en 21 ciudades alrededor del mundo. Es un espacio en el que convergen activistas, empresarios, emprendedores, inversores, artistas, políticos y periodistas que buscan explorar formas de identidad colaborativa y una nueva reputación humana para resolver problemas que importan a la ciudadania de manera directa.
Su misión es abrir caminos hacia modelos de confianza y participación más humanos, colaborativos y descentralizados.
Logos, por su parte, es un stack tecnológico totalmente descentralizado, privado y políticamente neutral.
El stack incluye tres protocolos modulares:
λ Blockchain
λ Storage
λ Messaging
Combinados ofrecen los cimientos tecnológicos para la creación de nuevas formas de gobierno: ciberestados, sociedades paralelas, instituciones digitales sin fronteras basadas en el consentimiento voluntario.
Logos también es una red de comunidades de aprendizaje que sostienen y gobiernan el ecosistema, al estilo del espíritu cypherpunk original.
Logos y Circles forman el movimiento de base que necesitamos para construir nuevas instituciones sociales, económicas y de gobernanza que funcionen sobre esta tecnología.
Con el tiempo, estas instituciones van a crear un mercado más competitivo, capaz de cubrir los vacíos de gobernanza que existen en el mundo real, ofreciendo servicios públicos con mínima necesidad de confianza y resistentes a la corrupción, en cualquier lugar donde llegue internet.
Si querés profundizar más en nuestra tecnología e ideales, podés explorar el Logos Manifesto.

We're creating the tools for parallel societies: privacy-preserving communications, censorship-resistant storage, and decentralized consensus all politically neutral, fully open-source, and designed to restore agency to individuals and communities.

About Logos
Logos is a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols: Nomos (consensus), Codex (storage), and Waku (messaging). Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyber states, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
Logos is also a collection of learning communities that will govern and sustain the network in the spirit of the original cypherpunks. Together, they form the grassroots movement needed to build the social, economic, and governing institutions that will live on the technology stack.
Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach.
Read our manifesto to dive deeper into our ideals and technology.

stg_external_circle_circle_event.event_description:
The Peace of Westphalia (1648) established the nation-state to stop Europeans from killing each other over religion. Today, that same system is the primary engine of global conflict, financial censorship, and local decay.
Why are we using 17th-century technology to run 21st-century lives?
The state has failed to protect our privacy, failed to preserve our wealth, and failed to represent our local interests. But for the first time in history, we have the tools to build something better. We don't need a revolution of blood; we need a revolution of code.
We are hosting a small, high-signal meetup to discuss how Blockchain Governance can replace the rotting infrastructure of the state, starting right here in our neighborhood.

Acerca de Logos
Logos es un movimiento de código abierto que construye un stack tecnológico descentralizado que materializa la visión cypherpunk de territorios digitales autónomos y ciber-estados.
Messaging: Redes de comunicación anónimas para mensajería resistente a adversarios estatales.
Almacenamiento descentralizado para datos persistentes a la coerción, compartición de archivos y distribución de aplicaciones.
Blockchain que preserva la privacidad para el orden y la gobernanza soberanas.
Este stack tecnológico es la base necesaria para construir las instituciones sociales, económicas y de gobernanza. Por su parte, las comunidades de aprendizaje gobernarán y sostendrán la red en el espíritu de los cypherpunks originales.
Con el tiempo, estas instituciones poblarán un mercado competitivo que puede llenar vacíos de gobernanza en el mundo real, ofreciendo servicios públicos confiables y resistentes a la corrupción en cualquier lugar al que llegue Internet.
Lee nuestro Manifiesto para profundizar más sobre la tecnología e ideales de Logos.

Welcome to the Logos Circle London chapter!
We believe real change starts at the local level. Join us in the heart of the City, steps from the Monument to the Great Fire of London. Fun fact: This 202-foot Doric column, crowned by a gilded flame, exactly 202 feet west of where the 1666 fire started, stands as tribute to London's unbreakable spirit, honouring the city's phoenix-like rebirth and rapid reconstruction into a grander metropolis.
Everyone is welcome, whether you're ready to get involved or just curious to learn more.

Welcome and Intros

A Logos é um stack de tecnologia totalmente descentralizado, com preservação de privacidade e politicamente neutro. Combinados, eles fornecem a base técnica para cyberestados, sociedades paralelas, Network States ou qualquer instituição pública sem fronteiras baseada em consentimento voluntário.
A Logos é também um conjunto de comunidades em aprendizado que irão governar e sustentar a rede no espírito dos cypherpunks originais. Juntas, elas formam o movimento de base necessário para construir as instituições sociais, econômicas e de governo que viverão sobre o stack de tecnologia.

About Logos
Logos is a fully decentralised, privacy-preserving, and politically neutral technology stack. The stack includes three modular, decentralised protocols for consensus, storage, and communications. Combined, they provide the technical foundation for cyber states, parallel societies, network states, or any borderless public institution based on voluntary consent.
Logos is also a collection of learning communities that will govern and sustain the network in the spirit of the original cypherpunks. Together, they form the grassroots movement needed to build the social, economic, and governing institutions that will live on the technology stack.
Eventually, these institutions will populate a competitive marketplace that can fill gaps in governance in the real world, providing trust-minimised, corruption-resistant public services wherever the internet can reach.

Logos Circle: Los Angeles - Work Group Session
Location provided to approved attendees

What We're Building
This is a work session for the LA Logos Circle, the objective is to move from concepts to code. Following productive discussions at previous gatherings, we're ready to begin technical implementation on a proof-of-concept for privacy preserving local community tools.
Our focus: an anonymous neighborhood engagement platform that lets people participate in local issues without sacrificing their privacy. Think community reporting and coordination, but built on principles of self-sovereignty rather than surveillance.
Session Objectives
We'll break into working groups to tackle core components:
Identity & Privacy Layer
Zero-knowledge approaches to verify community membership without exposing who you are or exactly where you live.
Messaging Infrastructure
Leveraging Logos Messaging for private, censorship-resistant communication between neighbors.
Incentive Mechanisms
Designing staking and reputation systems that encourage genuine participation while deterring bad actors.
User Experience
Making privacy-first design actually usable for everyday community members.
Who Should Attend
This session is for builders ready to contribute. Whether your expertise is in cryptography, frontend development, mechanism design, or UX, if you're prepared to roll up your sleeves and help prototype solutions for real LA community challenges, we want you there.
Prior attendance at Logos Circle events is helpful but not required. Familiarity with the Logos tech stack (Blockchain, Storage, Messaging) is a plus.
Details
Food and drinks provided. Come ready to work.
This is an invite-only session. If you're interested in attending, request access and we'll follow up with location details for approved guests.

The LA Logos Circle is part of a global network of communities building decentralized infrastructure for self-sovereign governance. Learn more at circles.logos.co

Sobre a Logos
A Logos é um stack de tecnologia totalmente descentralizado, com preservação de privacidade e politicamente neutro. O stack inclui três protocolos modulares e descentralizados: Blockchain, Mensagens e Armazenamento (Storage). Combinados, eles fornecem a base técnica para cyberestados, sociedades paralelas, Network States ou qualquer instituição pública sem fronteiras baseada em consentimento voluntário.
A Logos é também um conjunto de comunidades em aprendizado que irão governar e sustentar a rede no espírito dos cypherpunks originais. Juntas, elas formam o movimento de base necessário para construir as instituições sociais, econômicas e de governo que viverão sobre o stack de tecnologia.
Eventualmente, essas instituições irão popular um mercado competitivo que pode preencher lacunas de governança no mundo real, fornecendo serviços públicos com minimização de confiança e resistentes à corrupção onde quer que a internet possa alcançar.
Leia nosso manifesto para se aprofundar em nossos ideais e tecnologia.

Acerca de Logos
Logos es un movimiento de código abierto que construye un stack tecnológico descentralizado que materializa la visión cypherpunk de territorios digitales autónomos y ciber-estados.
Messaging: Redes de comunicación anónimas para mensajería resistente a adversarios estatales.
Almacenamiento descentralizado para datos persistentes a la coerción, compartición de archivos y distribución de aplicaciones.
Blockchain que preserva la privacidad para el orden y la gobernanza soberanas.
Este stack tecnológico es la base necesaria para construir las instituciones sociales, económicas y de gobernanza. Por su parte, las comunidades de aprendizaje gobernarán y sostendrán la red en el espíritu de los cypherpunks originales.
Con el tiempo, estas instituciones poblarán un mercado competitivo que puede llenar vacíos de gobernanza en el mundo real, ofreciendo servicios públicos confiables y resistentes a la corrupción en cualquier lugar al que llegue Internet.
Te invitamos a leer nuestro Manifiesto para profundizar más sobre la tecnología e ideales de Logos.
También te invitamos a visitar el sitio web Logos

Първи Балкански Кръг!
Добре дошли на първата среща на Кръг Logos на Балканите, която се провежда в Русе - Града на първите неща. Русе отдавна е място където се раждат нови идеи, което го прави естествена отправна точка за изграждането на местна общност Logos на Балканите. Това първо събитие е възможност да се срещнете с колеги, да обсъдите общи проблеми и да видите как децентрализираната технология и социалните действия могат да подкрепят значими промени на местно ниво.
Програма
Напитки и закуски за Добре дошли.
Насладете се на местни закуски и напитки, докато се поздравяваме и се настаняваме.
Представяне
Запознайте се с местните администратори на Кръг Logos. Ще бъдете поканени да споделите нещо за вашата история и защо тази работа е от значение за вас.
Фокусиране върху местни проблеми
Дискусия за вече започнати местни инициативи, възникващи предизвикателства и как Logos може окаже подкрепа чрез социални действия.
Сбогом!
Ще споделим пътната карта за това как можете да се включите и кога ще се съберем отново.
За Logos
Logos е напълно децентрализирана, спазваща поверителност и политически неутрална технологична платформа. Стека включва три модулни децентрализирани протокола: Блокчейн, Съобщения, и Съхранение. В комбинация, те осигуряват техническата основа за кибер държави, паралелни общества, мрежови държави или всякакви публични институции без граници, основани на доброволно съгласие.
Logos е и колекция от учебни общности, които ще управляват и поддържат мрежата в духа на оригиналните cypherpunks. Заедно, те формират гражданското движение необходимо за изграждането на социалните, икономическите и управленските институции които ще съществуват в технологичния стек.
В крайна сметка, тези институции ще се включат в конкурентен пазар, който може да запълни празнините в управлението в реалния свят, предоставяйки публични услуги с минимално участие на външни посредници и устойчиви на корупция, навсякъде където има достъп до интернет.
Прочетете нашия манифест, за да се запознаете по-подробно с нашите идеали и технология.
